comments.author: The Maxx

comments.text:
+The Maxx No. That fact is technically false, as there's really no way to 
measure when reality actually happens. Even if we could do that, we'd just 
be processing what actually happened, too late. We wouldn't be time 
traveling, because we're not actually traveling through time.

comments.author: Helloandhaveaniceday

comments.text:
I don't see why people are complaining about the star one. Loads of 
elements have been forged through nuclear fusion, however if they are 
talking proportion wise, it is impossible for hydrogen to have been fused 
so that is not true, and the number wise, well, it becomes unstable after 
iron so depends what chemicals are in the body. The actual particles, 
almost certainly not made in a star. Made BY a star, yes, but the Earth 
wasn't made IN a star was it? It was forged by the magratheans obviously.﻿
comments.author: Madscientist jr

comments.text:
First of all it is a zip, not zipper, second of all I have never seen that, 
and being a little OCD in whatever situation I find myself in with a coat I 
HAVE checked them.﻿
comments.author: Madscientist jr

comments.text:
What I meant by 'original word' was that zipper was first, and zip came 
later.  It was originally something along the lines of a 'separable clasp 
closure'.

 It began getting called a zipper, as you mentioned, when the B. F. 
Goodrich Company began using it on boots, and from there the name stuck. It 
is from the word zipper, that the nickname 'zip' popped up.
comments.author: peepslostsheep

comments.text:
+peepslostsheep No it wasn't. Neither was the original, and zipper was a 
nickname from an old shoe or something that stuck in America.
comments.author: Madscientist jr

comments.text:
+Madscientist jr I've been up and down the East coast of the USA, Florida 
to Maine, as well as a few states to the West, and I've never heard anyone 
call them 'zips'. 

I'm aware that in the UK they are typically just called a zip, or zips, 
however, the original word was zipper.
comments.author: peepslostsheep

comments.text: +Madscientist jr Well I guess California, USA isn't one of those places.
